channel: LCW Buddy Program for Cross-Cultural Learning / Week 3
message: Lesson 3 is also now posted in the "Files" tab. Special notes: Critical Background for the LCW Team: The 4 mini-videos leveraged in this lesson are brand new, and have just recently been added to the LCW solutions deck. For almost everyone at LCW, this lesson is their first opportunity to view these videos. T he idea for them came in the early days of COVID-19 and before the murder of George Floyd, when LCW was faced with a dramatic drop in contracts and revenue. As organizations responded to the epidemic by scaling back their training and spending, LCW looked inward at that moment to seize the new found ‘down time’ to innovate new product ideas, among them the “mini-video rapid design” concept of: (a) building bite-sized videos quickly and relatively cheaply by putting to work the operation team’s skillsets for video production alongside the consulting team’s content knowledge, (b) developing the content in a collaborative process where several LCW consultants would work together on script-writing and iterations to bring the videos to life in the best way for our clients. Shortly after this plan was hatched, the murder of George Floyd led to such a dramatic spike in everyone’s workload that no one had time to fully execute on the multi-person, collaborative nature of these initial plans. Instead, a new ‘proof of concept’ plan emerged; these 4 mini-videos would be produced as a side project in whatever moments a couple of LCW staff members could carve out. Now that LCW’s staff has grown and the team once again has sufficient bandwidth to innovate, a parallel goal of Lesson 3 is to provide a fresh look at the opportunity these 4 proof of concept mini-videos present. What can/should/will LCW do next? How can LCW build on this proof of concept with new products? What products in this category would most ‘wow’ LCW clients and deliver on LCW’s value proposition? NOTE: This lesson is also designed with the shorter 4-day work week in mind, and should take you half as much time to complete as previous lessons.

message: Hey everyone. Before July 9 , we ask you to meet in your original small group and come up with 2-3 possible ideas to submit for new LCW eLearning, microlearning or videos (e.g. using Rise and/or Storyline). You will submit those 2-3 ideas using a template provided. Those ideas will then be reconciled/consolidated down into FOUR ideas by July 12th; your group will then be assigned one of those four ideas to collaborate on with another group as part of an innovation lab, in the week leading up to and also during the All-Staff Retreat in Chicago.

well i caanot get back in

Hi Team, Please make sure to attend one of the two meeting options that will cover Compass Invoicing OPTION #1: Monday, March 21st at 10a CST OPTION #2: Wednesday, March 23rd at 11a CST Some of you have asked for info on what deliverables should/should not be added to Compass. Here are some guidelines to assist you: - If your open/active SOWs contain deliverables that HAVE been both delivered AND invoiced in prior years (prior to 2022) = You DO NOT need to add those deliverables to Compass - However, IF you choose to add deliverables that have been both delivered and invoiced in prior years, you must create an Invoice in Compass & mark the Accounting Status as “Legacy Invoice” - To create the invoice, from the Quote page select “Use data on quote to Create Invoice.” From here, you will choose “Select lines for partial invoicing.” This will allow you to select only the deliverables that you need to invoice for. A box will pop up where you will check the deliverables you wish to add to your invoice. After selecting your deliverables, select “Proceed”. An Invoice is then created. Since this is a “dummy” invoice, there is no need to edit any information. However, you must select “Legacy Invoice” from the Accounting Status and hit Save. Once you return to your Quote, you will see your invoice under “Invoices.” - For already invoiced items, you can group them all into 1 deliverable if easier (EX: put 100 IDIs on one line or 5 UTBEs on one line) - If your open/active SOWs contain deliverables that HAVE been invoiced but HAVE NOT been delivered = You MUST add deliverables to Compass - You must also create a “Prepayment Invoice” in Compass & mark the Accounting Status as “Legacy Invoice” - To create the prepayment invoice, from the Quote page select “Use date on quote to Create Prepayment Invoice.” From here, you will choose “Select lines for partial invoicing.” This will allow you to select on the deliverables that you have pre-invoiced for. You can also choose to pre-invoice a percentage of all deliverables. After making your selection, select “Proceed.” An Invoice is then created. Since this is a “dummy” invoice, there is no need to edit any information. However, you must select “Legacy Invoice” from the Accounting Status and hit Save. Once you return to your Quote, you will see your invoice under “Prepayment Invoices.” - For already invoiced items, you can group them all into 1 deliverable if easier - If your open/active SOWs contain deliverables that HAVE NOT been invoiced but HAVE been delivered = You MUST add deliverables to Compass
